string-array.item: What consumes your Mind, controls your life. - Mel Robbins
Tears are words that need to be written. - Paulo Coelho
Action is the antidote to despair. - Joan Baez
Difficult roads lead to beautiful destinations. - Zig Ziglar‚Äù

resources.string: SettingsActivity

Hello first fragment
Hello second fragment. Arg: %1$s
We recommend you to work on Emotional Regulation. Try writing out the emotions you are experiencing in the Feelings Diary and reflect on those emotions.
We recommend you to work on Distress Tolerance. Try setting yourself 15 to 20 minutes to meditate in order to give yourself a chance to unwind using the timer on your phone.

We recommend you to work on Interpersonal Effectiveness. Try setting yourself some time to reach out to one of your contacts. Being social will further improve your communication and listening skills.

We recommend you to work on Mindfulness. Try setting yourself some time to take a break and watch a thought provoking video on YouTube. We will also direct you to a channel that we think can help further your knowledge on mental health.
Have you recently harbored any suicidal thoughts?
Have you recently thought about self harm, physical or other?
Have you recently performed acts of self harm, physical or other?
Have you recently attempted suicide?
Have you recently considered suicide or self harm as an answer to your problems?
Have you recently been tardy or absent in checking in with this therapy program?
Have you recently considered stopping coming to therapy?
Have you recently felt a loss in motivation in continuing this therapy?
Have you recently had problems in your relationships, whether they be familial, platonic, or romantic?
Have you recently been diagnosed with a mental illness that could affect your goals?
Have you recently experienced or are experiencing problems with your current housing arrangements?
Are you willing to learn new skills in order to create better habits and reach your goals?
Are you willing to build new relationships to better your mindset?
Are you willing to learn how to manage your emotions to deal with life problems?
